message: Here we go!

thanks!

python ets/ets_docs.py update chaco
Hey varun, yes let's talk here
this is an excellent place to discuss. I'm also looking at the chaco examples right now
jonathan: I'm back and have been looking at the chaco examples, and have some suggestions for the documentation page. Is this a good place to discuss?
Hey Gael, where should the links on this page point (http://code.enthought.com/projects/mayavi/devdetails.php)?
...and then we can jump into more complex examples.
I've some questions: why doesn't chaco plot take python lists as inputs?
@GaelVaroquaux Yeah, I haven't updated this one yet.  So which page on github was my original question?
the plot part is stil TODO !!!!!!

I'm looking at the Quickstart page, and I think we should add some basic plotting example there just to show how to plot x vs. y data, how to set legend text, how to save the figure (which is not explained), etc... basically  a mini howto on how to move from matplotlib to chaco.
the installation is dated as well

@scopatz No, it should point to the corresponding page on github. The reason being that when people google up a Mayavi problem, they land on these pages. We have invested a lot of energy in this (linking to these pages, putting the right keywords on them). Thus we want them to get to their answer quickly.
Ideally, there would be an automatic redirection from every CEC documentation page to the corresponding enthought.github one.
... and we're back
it would be trivial to accept lists and convert them first though
ok, thanks for the question
hey varun

Hi Corran! On the list that I can see here:
- Traits & Chaco intro (Jonathan R. is working on this now)
- Chaco procedural (shell) mode intro
- Updating Examples (make sure they work, fixing when they don't)
- Migrating trac -> gh issues
hi, so we are back.
yes.
also... in the shell/lines.py example i am unable to move the legend. Do we need to do something special to be able to move the legend after plotting?

Is it true that we can't save 'eps' figures with chaco? chaco 'save' routine says only 'bmp, png and jpg' are supported. When i try save('name.eps') it doesn't do anything .. no error and no plot saved!

ok, i wouldn't mind giving it a try if you could point me to some documentation. Also I found in the source code that save routine simply skips over unsupported formats without displaying any message. Could I add a message saying "format not supported" and push to github? Are we allowed to modify source code?
still here? To answer your question from earlier, the goal of Chaco is to plot efficiently large datasets. So it assumes Numpy arrays as inputs
I don't see a legend. Were you talking about a different example?
I worked quite a bit on kiva back in December, but I don't remember how well eps rendering worked. PDF rendering works pretty well now.
Yes. I believe the current documentation is bad or non-existent.
exactly...
I mostly use lists with matplotlib.
You can add a legend to that example from python shell (as explained on the Quickstart page).. or you can also directly add 'legend' line in the code.
does matplotlib accept lists?
is that why you thought of that?
@varun: eps output is technically supported by kiva, so it shouldn't be too difficult to fix that bug. (famous last words, I know...)
@varun: yes please. bug fixes are always welcome :)
@varun: chaco/examples/noninteractive.py contains code that renders using different backends
@varun Arguably it should, but it would convert them to numpy arrays on the backend before plotting

@cwebster This mailing list thread https://mail.enthought.com/pipermail/enthought-dev/2011-February/028332.html revealed a bug in the initialization of mapped traits.  Not sure if fixing it is a small project.
Hi from beautiful Jersey City!  I'm going to grab dinner in a minute, but does anyone have a quick little project to look at this evening in my down time?
Ah - I know a little about the Chaco shell mode.  The idea is to document it somewhat?
@jwiggins: thanks, will take a look.
A new class will be needed.. (PsPlotGraphicsContext perhaps?) It will probably be very similar to PdfPlotGraphicsContext or SVGGraphicsContext

When I try to push to github, I get an error: error: Cannot access URL https://varunh@github.com/enthought/chaco.git/, return code 22
error: failed to push some refs to 'https://varunh@github.com/enthought/chaco.git'
Docs are probably more my speed this evening.  Thanks for the pointers.  I'll grab some food and be back in a bit.
@varun Hey I had the same error. You need to change the origin to the SSH link. So do a git remote rm origin
and then a git remote add origin git@github.com:enthought/chaco.git
@jonathanrocher thanks it worked.
Another issue that we discovered during the class last week: the + and - keys should zoom a chaco plot, but the + key does not work if one uses "shift-=" to get the + key.
